results.title: Metformin and simvastatin synergistically suppress endothelin 1-induced hypoxia and angiogenesis in multiple cancer types
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (@GENE_SLTM @GENE_79811 @@@MET@@@) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SVA@@@), two metabolic-related drugs, have been shown to play important roles in modulating the @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ microenvironment and angiogenesis.

citations.NLM: Liu J, Wang H, Zhang M, Li Y, Wang R, Chen H, Wang B, Gao X, Song S, Wang Y, Ren Y, Li J, Liu P. Metformin and simvastatin synergistically suppress endothelin 1-induced hypoxia and angiogenesis in multiple cancer types Cancer Sci. 2023 Feb;114(2):640-653. PMID: 36156330
citations.BibTeX: @article{36156330, title={Metformin and simvastatin synergistically suppress endothelin 1-induced hypoxia and angiogenesis in multiple cancer types}, author={Liu J and Wang H and Zhang M and Li Y and Wang R and Chen H and Wang B and Gao X and Song S and Wang Y and Ren Y and Li J and Liu P}, journal={Cancer Sci}, volume={114}, number={2}, pages={640-653}}

results.title: Cellular mechanisms involved in the pathogenesis of airway remodeling in chronic lung disease
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ decreased @GENE_SAA1 @GENE_6288 @@@SAA1@@@ and @GENE_SAA2 @GENE_6289 @@@SAA2@@@ mRNA in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ lung fibroblasts (1.2 and 1.6-fold, respectively, versus untreated cells) under @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ conditions (Figure 5).

citations.NLM: Arellano-Orden E, Calero Acuña C, Sánchez-López V, López Ramírez C, Otero-Candelera R, Marín-Hinojosa C, López Campos J. Cellular mechanisms involved in the pathogenesis of airway remodeling in chronic lung disease Eur Clin Respir J. 2022;9(1):2097377. PMID: 35832729

results.title: Simvastatin protects against long-lasting behavioral and morphological consequences of neonatal hypoxic/ischemic brain injury.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ protects against long-lasting behavioral and morphological consequences of neonatal @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@/@DISEASE_Brain_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D001930 @@@ischemic brain injury@@@.

citations.NLM: Balduini W, De Angelis V, Mazzoni E, Cimino M. Simvastatin protects against long-lasting behavioral and morphological consequences of neonatal hypoxic/ischemic brain injury. Stroke. 2001 Sep;32(9):2185-91. PMID: 11546915

results.title: Blood brain barrier in hypoxic-ischemic conditions.
results.text_hl: Although future research is needed to look into possible therapeutic strategies to improve the functioning of BBB in @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ conditions, experimental studies so far have reported beneficial effect of @CHEMICAL_Curcumin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003474 @@@curcumin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Melatonin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008550 @@@melatonin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Minocycline @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008911 @@@minocycline@@@ in ameliorating the increased BBB permeability in @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ conditions.

citations.NLM: Kaur C, Ling EA. Blood brain barrier in hypoxic-ischemic conditions. Curr Neurovasc Res. 2008 Feb;5(1):71-81. PMID: 18289024
citations.BibTeX: @article{18289024, title={Blood brain barrier in hypoxic-ischemic conditions.}, author={Kaur C and Ling EA}, journal={Curr Neurovasc Res}, volume={5}, number={1}, pages={71-81}}

results.title: Effects of simvastatin on the expression of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 mRNA in neonatal brain with hypoxic-ischemic damage.
results.text_hl: The goal of this paper is to report on the study of the mechanism of @DISEASE_Leprosy_Tuberculoid @DISEASE_MESH:D015441 @@@neural damage@@@ in neonatal cerebral cortex and hippocampus when @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic-ischemic brain damage@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@HIBD@@@) occurs and the neural protective effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Miao H, Jiang L, Huang L. Effects of simvastatin on the expression of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 mRNA in neonatal brain with hypoxic-ischemic damage. J Nanosci Nanotechnol. 2005 Aug;5(8):1261-5. PMID: 16193989
citations.BibTeX: @article{16193989, title={Effects of simvastatin on the expression of intercellular adhesion molecule-1 mRNA in neonatal brain with hypoxic-ischemic damage.}, author={Miao H and Jiang L and Huang L}, journal={J Nanosci Nanotechnol}, volume={5}, number={8}, pages={1261-5}}

results.title: Biochemical Changes in Erythrocytes as a Molecular Marker of Cell Damage during Long-Term Simvastatin Treatment.
results.text_hl: Long-term administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ to @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, irrespective of the baseline @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ levels, induced biochemical changes in erythrocytes attesting to @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic damage@@@ (accumulation of @CHEMICAL_Lactic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019344 @@@lactate@@@ and @CHEMICAL_2_3_Diphosphoglycerate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019794 @@@2,3-diphosphoglycerate@@@), disturbances in @CHEMICAL_Adenosine_Triphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000255 @@@ATP@@@-dependent mechanisms of ion homeostasis regulation (decrease in total ATPase and Ca(2+)-ATPase activities), and antioxidant enzymes system imbalance.

citations.NLM: Mikashinovich ZI, Belousova ES. Biochemical Changes in Erythrocytes as a Molecular Marker of Cell Damage during Long-Term Simvastatin Treatment. Bull Exp Biol Med. 2016 Aug;161(4):600-3. PMID: 27591878
citations.BibTeX: @article{27591878, title={Biochemical Changes in Erythrocytes as a Molecular Marker of Cell Damage during Long-Term Simvastatin Treatment.}, author={Mikashinovich ZI and Belousova ES}, journal={Bull Exp Biol Med}, volume={161}, number={4}, pages={600-3}}

results.title: Simvastatin acutely reduces ischemic brain damage in the immature rat via Akt and CREB activation.
results.text_hl: These data demonstrate that even a single prophylactic @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Sim@@@ administration protects from @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic ischemic brain damage@@@ and that neuroprotection is in part obtained by preserving @GENE_AKT1 @GENE_24185 @@@Akt@@@ and stimulating @GENE_CREB1 @GENE_81646 @@@CREB@@@ phosphorylation in neuronal cells.

citations.NLM: Carloni S, Girelli S, Buonocore G, Longini M, Balduini W. Simvastatin acutely reduces ischemic brain damage in the immature rat via Akt and CREB activation. Exp Neurol. 2009 Nov;220(1):82-9. PMID: 19664625
citations.BibTeX: @article{19664625, title={Simvastatin acutely reduces ischemic brain damage in the immature rat via Akt and CREB activation.}, author={Carloni S and Girelli S and Buonocore G and Longini M and Balduini W}, journal={Exp Neurol}, volume={220}, number={1}, pages={82-9}}

results.title: Inhibition of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl (HMG)-CoA reductase blocks hypoxia-mediated down-regulation of endothelial nitric oxide synthase.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Dactinomycin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003609 @@@Actinomycin D@@@ studies revealed that under @<m>DISEASE_Hypoxia_Brain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002534 @@@hypoxic@@@ conditions, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ increased @GENE_NOS3 @GENE_4846 @@@ecNOS@@@ mRNA half-life from 13 to 38 h.

citations.NLM: Laufs U, Fata VL, Liao JK. Inhibition of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaryl (HMG)-CoA reductase blocks hypoxia-mediated down-regulation of endothelial nitric oxide synthase. J Biol Chem. 1997 Dec 12;272(50):31725-9. PMID: 9395516
